item.title: Jared add a quote by Jon Krakauer
item.description: "Mountains make poor receptacles for dreams." -- Jon Krakauer

item.title: Jared add a quote by Rebecca Solnit
item.description: "When someone doesn't show up, the people who wait sometimes tell stories about what might have happened and come to half believe the desertion, the abduction, the accident. Worry is a way to pretend that you have knowledge or control over what you don't--and it surprises me, even in myself, how much we prefer ugly scenarios to the pure unknown. Perhaps fantasy is what you fill up maps with rather than saying that they too contain the unknown." -- Rebecca Solnit

item.title: Jared add a quote by Else Lasker-Schüler
item.description: "A true poet does not say 'azure'; a true poet says 'blue." -- Else Lasker-Schüler

item.title: Jared add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "I have no money, no resources, no hopes. I am the happiest man alive." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Jared add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "The language that reveals also obscures." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Jared add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "In wine there is wisdom, in beer there is Freedom, in water there is bacteria." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Jared add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The legitimate powers of government extend to such acts only as are injurious to others. It does me no injury for my neighbor to say there are twenty gods or no god. It neither picks my pocket nor breaks my leg." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Jared add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "No doubt alcohol, tobacco, and so forth, are things that a saint must avoid; but sainthood is also a thing that human beings must avoid." -- George Orwell

item.title: Jared add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Do I contradict myself? Very well, then, I contradict myself; I am large -- I contain multitudes." -- Walt Whitman
